author: chris2_2_2
content: Actually frightening how little block space defi and nft are taking up

author: treyzania
content: why is that frightening?

author: chris2_2_2
content: Seeing there be less demand to use the ethereum network is scary to me

author: chris2_2_2
content: The whole nft craze wasn‚Äôt sustainable but also demand has dropped like a rock rather than gradually and it really hasn‚Äôt picked up

author: treyzania
content: I see it as healthy since it means speculative uses that don't survive boom-bust cycles are being selected out and there's more capacity for uses that facilitate more real world value creation

author: chris2_2_2
content: I mean boom/bust in terms of price I get but in terms of network activity is scary

author: chris2_2_2
content: Just like stocks may go up or down but employment/consumer spending shouldn‚Äôt change much

author: treyzania
content: It's just a natural consequence so it shouldn't be surprising

author: chris2_2_2
content: I figured with crypto going down things become cheaper to do thus average activity should not change üòÖ

author: chris2_2_2
content: But it seems like a lot of people got out of crypto in general

author: sky.cactus
content: I'm with treyzania, most of the activity on Ethereum is garbage that I would rather see just go away so we can free up space for *actually* useful things.  I'm personally happy to see the fat get cut out.

author: treyzania
content: There is simply less demand for gas because much of the recent consumption was for speculative uses that are no longer happening, so yes it makes sense gas costs go down

author: sky.cactus
content: Those "users" that we got who were just doing stupid things weren't really people who were using Ethereum because of actual value it added.  They were using it because some scammer convinced them to join a ponzi.  Better that those people learn their lesson early than late.

author: chris2_2_2
content: It‚Äôs a good point I just find it scary. Especially looking at the daily volumes of trades on dexs both for eth and polygon.

author: sky.cactus
content: Each time the ponzis get burned down, society as a whole gets a *little* bit smarter and hopefully will better understand things next time around.  Enough burning and eventually most people will understand that crypto != ponzi schemes.

author: chris2_2_2
content: I understand. And don‚Äôt get me wrong I love being able to use eth and pay less than 20 gwei. But I guess I don‚Äôt like rapid change.

author: mrfwashere
content: on the other hand it can be argued that the ponzis are an important means to the end of greater adoption - for every N people who get involved for a stupid ponzi, some number of those will stick around and get into more serious usage or even development, becoming "real" users

author: mrfwashere
content: if nobody was using ethereum for "stupid" things then it would be a lot less discovered

author: mrfwashere
content: (i started using ethereum to buy into Proof of Weak Hands)

author: chris2_2_2
content: Because I had eth from mining and was curious‚Ä¶I‚Äôm guessing the hands were as weak as advertised

author: sky.cactus
content: I think we permanently lose more potential users than we gain due to people getting scammend and then assuming that "everything on Ethereum is a scam".

author: mrfwashere
content: possible... certainly impossible to measure. but how much "real" usage is there that isn't ponzis? to me most of defi is just dressed up ponzis pretending not to be ponzis, and without all that what do we have left?

author: mrfwashere
content: if the operators and developers are honest and upfront then decentralized gambling and games can be superior to centralized ones and valuable entertainment to a lot of people

author: chris2_2_2
content: Though even honesty isn‚Äôt 100% given how many things seem to get hacked

author: chris2_2_2
content: I do like that more open source code that‚Äôs almost bulletproof is getting out there like how many are reusing uniswaps

author: mrfwashere
content: sure, i just think its a bit myopic to judge people for how they want to use this platform, humans are degenerate by nature and they are not "wrong" for using ethereum for gambling and entertainment when its extremely powerful for it

author: mrfwashere
content: the bad people are those who outright scam, lie and deceive, but not all ponzi like things are like that nor are all users who participate useless

author: chris2_2_2
content: I love how the ‚Äúdeep state‚Äù is actually a thing in ethereum
